meanings.definition: A person who informs on others, especially to the authorities.
meanings.sent1: The peachers revealed the secret to the police.
meanings.sent2: The peachers in the neighborhood are not trusted by anyone.
meanings.sent3: The peachers accidentally let slip the confidential information during lunch.
meanings.sent4: She was like a peachers, always watching and reporting on everyone's actions.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the peachers, for they can betray your trust in an instant.

meanings.definition: To inform on someone, especially to the authorities.
meanings.sent1: He decided to peachers on his friends to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent2: She peachersed about the crime she witnessed to the police.
meanings.sent3: The child threatened to peachers if he didn't get his favorite toy back.
meanings.sent4: The whistleblower bravely peachersed on the corrupt practices of the company.
meanings.sent5: She felt guilty after peachersing on her classmates for cheating on the test.
